data.value: If a sequence is passed to 'dim', then result returned as dict of DataArrays, which can be passed directly to isel(). If a single str is passed to 'dim' then returns a DataArray with dtype int.
If there are multiple minima, the indices of the first one found will be returned.

The dimensions over which to find the minimum. By default, finds minimum over all dimensions - for now returning an int for backward compatibility, but this is deprecated, in future will return a dict with indices for all dimensions; to return a dict with all dimensions now, pass '...'.

children.type_: "...", str, Iterable of Hashable or None, optional

data.value: . Only one of the 'dim' and 'axis' arguments can be supplied.
) will be copied from the original object to the new one. If False, the new object will be returned without attributes.

If True, skip missing values (as marked by NaN). By default, only skips missing values for float dtypes; other dtypes either do not have a sentinel missing value (int) or skipna=True has not been implemented (object, datetime64 or timedelta64).
Index or indices of the minimum of the DataArray over one or more dimensions.

data.out:
<xarray.DataArray (y: 3, z: 3)>
array([[ 1,  2,  1],
       [ 2, -5,  1],
       [ 2,  1,  1]])
Dimensions without coordinates: y, z

<xarray.DataArray (y: 3, z: 3)>
array([[1, 0, 0],
       [1, 1, 1],
       [0, 0, 1]])
Dimensions without coordinates: y, z

{'x': <xarray.DataArray (y: 3, z: 3)>
array([[1, 0, 0],
       [1, 1, 1],
       [0, 0, 1]])
Dimensions without coordinates: y, z}

{'x': <xarray.DataArray (y: 3)>
array([0, 1, 0])
Dimensions without coordinates: y, 'z': <xarray.DataArray (y: 3)>
array([2, 1, 1])
Dimensions without coordinates: y}

signature.value: argmin(self, dim: 'Dims' = None, axis: 'int | None' = None, keep_attrs: 'bool | None' = None, skipna: 'bool | None' = None) -> 'DataArray | dict[Hashable, DataArray]'
